comment: Used to make lists of Spells. (Remember you can always Duplicate with right-click)
Used to do spell effects for/as the opponent instead of yourself
Needed for nesting target players, e.g. 'Both players draw from their opponent's deck.'
Simply deal some damage. Works for a single target or multiple targets. Factors in Spell Power if used in a Spell card.
Like above, but won't factor in Spell Power if on a Spell card.
Simply do some healing. Works for a single target or multiple targets. Factors in healing amplifiers.
Draw 1 card from your deck.
To do something to the card, use the block "the spell's output"
Draw multiple cards from your deck.
To do something to the card(s), use the block "the spell's output"
Draw some amount from cards in your deck that pass a given filter.
To do something to the card(s), use the block "the spell's output"
Buff the attack and health of something.
Buff the attack and health of the thing doing this spell.
Buffs the attack and health of something by the same amount
Buff just the attack of something.
Buff just the health of something.
Give a temporary attack and health buff to something
Give a temporary attack buff to something.
Give a specifically 1-turn only attack buff to something.
Only do a spell effect if a condition is met.
Do a spell effect if a condition is met for a specific target
Do one spell effect if a condition is met, or another if it's not.
Do a spell effect, then do another effect if a condition is now met.
Summon the unit associated with a given card.
Summon a copy of an already existing unit (new unit owned my caster of spell)
Summon multiple copies of an existing unit (new units owned my caster of spell)
To do something to the copy, use the block "the spell's output"
Summon a unit directly to the right of the unit casting this spell.

message0: %1Summon a copy of %2 to the right of this%3
comment: Summon a copy of a unit directly to the right of the unit casting this spell.
Summon a unit directly to the left of the unit casting this spell.
Summon multiple of the unit for a given card.
Summon random units from a filtered source of possibilies.
Summon the specific units listed.
Summon a number of random units from the ones listed.

message0: Summon a copy of %2 to the left then %3
comment: Summon a copy of a unit directly to the left of the unit casting this spell. To do something to the copy, use the block "the spell's output"

message0: Summon a copy of %2 to the right then %3
comment: Summon a copy of a unit directly to the right of the unit casting this spell. To do something to the copy, use the block "the spell's output"
Add the given cards to your hand.
Summon the specific units. To do something to the summoned units, use the block "the spell's output"
Summon a specific unit. To do something to the summoned unit, use the block "the spell's output"
Add the given card to your hand.
To do something to the card, use the block "the spell's output"
Add multiple of the same specific card to your hand.
Add multiple random cards from a specific filtered source.
Add multiple random cards to your hand from an unfiltered source.
To do something to the cards, use the block "the spell's output"
Add a card to your hand that needs to be specified through the targeting system, e.g. "your leftmost card"
Add the source card of a given target to your hand
To do something to the card, use the block "the spell's output"
To do something to the card, use the block "the spell's output"
Add multiple random cards to your hand from a specific list.
Do a spell effect on a unit and the ones right next to it
Do one spell effect on a unit, and another on the units right next to it.
Do a spell effect on the units adjacent to the unit doing this spell.
Do two spell effects.
Do multiple spell effects.
Not recommended for use by creators. It's mainly here so the algorithm can generate certain older cards coded in the before times.
Do multiple spell effects multiple times
Swap the attack of the thing doing this spell with the attack of something else
Swap the health of the thing doing this spell with the health of something else
Swap the health of two targets
Apply a (true/false) Attribute to something.
Apply an attribute to the thing doing this spell.
Temporarily apply a (true/false) Attribute to something.
Take away a (true/false) Attribute from something, if it had it.
Change the value of a (number) Attribute of something by a given amount.
Temporarily change the value of a (number) Attribute of something by a given amount.
Change the value of a (number) Attribute of something to a given amount.
Change the base attack value of something to a given value (WON'T affect attack bonuses).
Change the attack value of something to a given value (WILL affect attack bonuses)

message0: Set the base health of %2 to %3
comment: Change the base health value of something to a given value (WON'T affect hp bonuses)
Change the health value of something to a given value (WILL affect hp bonuses)
Sometimes, you just don't got no nothing that needs not doing.
Do a spell effect on multiple things at random.
Add an enchantment effect to something.

commnt: Add a more complicated Enchantment effect to something.

comment: Add a named card Enchantment effect to something (Useful if you want to specifically remove the enchantment later).
Add a temporary Enchantment effect to something.
Add a temporary, more complicated Enchantment effect to something.
Add an Aura effect to something.
Add a temporary Aura effect to something.
Remove a specific named card Enchantment effect from something.
Transform something into a fresh unit specific by the given card.
Transform a unit into a fresh copy of another unit.
Return a unit to its owner's hand.
Return a unit to its owner's hand. To do something to the card, use the block "the spell's output"
Increase your maximum lun by an amount.
Look at a few cards from a filtered source and do a spell effect based on the one chosen, often receiving it.
Look at a few cards from a specific list and do a spell effect based on the one chosen, often receiving it.

message0: Source %6 %7 from %2 %3 that %4 as ORIGINALS, not copies.
comment: Look at a few cards from a filtered source and do a spell effect using the actual cards themselves (use the block "it" in the spell instead of "the chosen card")
Use this for tricky cost modification. The other spells are simplifications of effects you could make with this.
Change the cost of a specific card.
Change the cost of the next card you play that passes given filters.
Change the cost of the next card you play that's a certain tribe.
Do a spell effect, then repeat it while a given condition remains true.
Pew pew pew
Equip the item specified by the given card.
Discard a random card in your hand
Discard a specifically targetted card, e.g. "your leftmost card".
Discard multiple random cards from your hand.
Discard a random card in your hand that passes a given filter.
Do a spell effect as if it was something else doing it.
Makes the target/targets attack another target or multiple other targets
To do something to the attacker, use the block "the spell's output"

message0: Make %4 attack %2 (doesn't use up an attack)
comment: Use if you don't want the forced attack to count as its chosen attack this turn.

message0: %1%2Summon a random unit from your hand
%1%3Summon a unit from your hand then %2
comment: To do something to the unit, use the block "the spell's output"

message0: Force the death phase to happen now%1
comment: By default, deaths don't happen until after your ENTIRE spell effect has resolved. Use this to make that happen at an earlier point as well.
When used in an Enchantment with a damage based trigger, this changes the damage of the event.
When used in an Enchantment with a damage based trigger, this changes the damage of the event.
Do a spell effect after all other spell effects going on right now have finished.
Makes your skill usable again if it was already used this turn.
Copy the aftermath effect from something and give it to this
Copy the aftermath effect from something and give it to another thing

message0: Put %3 of %2 on top of your deck
Put %3 of %2 on top of your deck %4 %5 down
comment: Put a card in your deck so that it's a certain number of cards down from the top.

custom: Turn the caster of the spell into an exact copy of a given unit

comment: Remove the targeted card from wherever it happens to be
Shuffle copies of a targeted unit into your deck

message0: Shuffle a copy of %2 into your deck then %3
comment: To do something to the shuffled card, use the block "the spell's output"
Shuffle multiple copies of the same card into your deck.

message0: Shuffle %2 %5 from %4 that %3 into your deck
comment: Shuffle some random cards from a filtered source into your deck.

message0: Shuffle %2 %6 from %5 that %4 into your deck, then %3
comment: To do something to the shuffled card(s), use the block "the spell's output"
Shuffles someting DIRECTLY into your deck, removing it from wherever it once was.
Transform a unit into something at random.
Do a spell effect multiple times.
Perform the same spell effect multiple times on random targets from a group.
Tells the game that you want this spell effect to be handled as a Skill
Tells the game that you want this spell effect to be handled as a Skill
Tells the game that you want this spell effect to be handled as a Supremacy
Applies the 'Decay' mechanic to a target.
Apply a new aftermath effect to a target.
Apply an Enchantment-card defined aftermath effect to a target.
Block for creating Invoke effects
Helper block for creating Invoke effects
Tells the game that you want this spell effect to be handled as a Quick Draw
'Roast' a number of cards off the top your deck
Summon units from your hand that pass a particular filter
Summon units from your deck that pass a particular filter

message0: Query %3 sorted by %4 Skipping the first %6 %7 (do) %5 on up to %2 of them in order
comment: A very complicated spell effect that can be very useful for some specific effects. It goes through a number of targets (potentially sorting them) and then does a spell effect on a specific subset of them in order.

message0: Query %3 that %8 sorted by %4 Skipping the first %6 %7 (do) %5 on up to %2 of them in order
comment: Same as above but with a filtered set of targets.
Steals a unit from your opponent's board and puts it on your board, unable to attack this turn. If there's no space, it gets destroyed.
To do something to the shuffled unit, use the block "the spell's output"
Does the effects of a (Spell) card on a given target.
Does the effects of a Spell card (that need to be targeted as an entity) on a given target.

message0: Replace the cards in %2 with ones from %4 that %3
comment: Replaces any cards targeted with random ones from a filtered source.
Replaces all cards targeted with a specific other card.
Just pretend this block doesn't exist

message0: Make each %3 attack a random other in %2
comment: Makes a target or targets attack a random other target or targets. Doesn't count as anybody's one chosen attack for a turn.
To do something to the revived unit, use the block "the spell's output"
To do something to the roasted card, use the block "the spell's output"
Due to some internal coding shenanigans, this block must be used to do things to adjacent units in an Aftermath

message0: Deal %2 damage to %4 and any excess to %3
comment: Deals up to the exact amount of damage need to kill a target, then does any excess to a different target.

message0: Deal the excess damage to %5 that you'd get from dealing %3 damage to %2
comment: This is a bit confusing, but to be clear: this only damages the first Target mentioned. The Value and second Target are just used in calculation; they don't get damaged by this. This is used to calculate excess damage for effects that weren't originally trying to care about excess damage.
Allow something to attack again this turn.
Buff or unbuffs a unit's attack as an Enrage effect
This is just like regular damage, except "the event's source" is treated as the one causing it.
Plays the card specified by the target entity with any necessary choices done randomly.
Creates and puts into play a Pact effect.
Gives a targeted card (probably in hand or deck) a new Opener effect.
